items.content_html:
This change would only apply to arrowhead marker. Setting 'refX' and 'refY' to the tip of the arrow head, that is the vertex (10,5) of the triangle, gives a more accurate representation of the arrow because it doesn't increase its length when adding the arrowhead. This is convenient for vectors representation.

Description

Motivation

Additional details

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: refX and refY set to the tip of the arrowhead

items.content_html:
In response to commentary in #30519: I added a paragraph describing the polygon() syntax in words vs examples or syntax specifications. For path() all it took was a sentence. Copied some bits from the polygon() page to the path() page to make them more alike.

Why are the file systems paths for these two pages different? Shouldn't path() be a sub-directory under basic-shape?
items.title: additions and standardizations for polygon() and path()

items.content_html:
Previous link redirected readers to Automated Selenium Testing On A Grid of 3000+ Browsers & Mobile Devices | BrowserStack page instead.

Description

Added correct link to indicate to readers where to find their BrowserStack username and access key.

Motivation

To help users easily find their BrowserStack username and access key.

Additional details

Previous link: Automated Selenium Testing On A Grid of 3000+ Browsers & Mobile Devices | BrowserStack
Current link: BrowserStack Account | Summary

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: fixed BrowserStack authentication information link

This is part of the #22441

items.content_html:
Description

The :nth-of-type() selector is listed twice, seemingly not on purpose. I have removed the second entry, as the placement of the first one feels more logical.

Motivation

It confused me for a moment while looking through CSS selectors. With how much I've learned from MDN, I figured I might as well give a little bit back, even if it's just a simple fix.
items.title: fix: remove duplicate nth-of-type entry

items.content_html:
Description

initial the documentation of WorkerNavigator.deviceMemory

specific the spec-urls meta data member of Device Memory API api summary page

add Extensions to other interfaces section to Device Memory API api summary page and so remove Navigator.deviceMemory from See also section

add Device Memory API to API group data and so use {{APIRef("Device Memory API")}} macros

mark experimental false of navigator.deviceMemory and Device-Memory header

add {{AvailableInWorkers}} to Device Memory API summary page, since this API can both used in Window and Worker

remove the incorrect mark of {{deprecated_inline}} of Device-Memory header in http headers summary

some other style update

Motivation

Additional details

Working on https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Device_Memory_API

Reference to https://www.w3.org/TR/device-memory/

Related issues and pull requests

Depends on: mdn/browser-compat-data#21350

Relates to #22441
items.title: some update to Device Memory API

This PR removes the pages for the pageXOffset and pageYOffset properties of the Window API, redirecting them to the scrollX and scrollY properties they aliases.

BCD PR: mdn/browser-compat-data#21348
items.title: Remove Window.page[X/Y]Offset pages

items.content_html: Console methods are now marked as static, this fixes the flaws induced by this move. (Also it fixes the sidebar as WorkerGlobalScope.console doesn't exist and won't.

items.content_html: First interactive glossary entry, useless, has been removed. Adapting the See also section here.

items.title: Remove use of grid-gap (in favor of gap) in Card

items.content_html:
In the previous state, the code presents the following error when the gulp command is ran:

Error [ERR_REQUIRE_ESM]: require() of ES Module /.../node-test/node_modules/gulp-autoprefixer/index.js from /.../node-test/gulpfile.js not supported. Instead change the require of index.js in /.../node-test/gulpfile.js to a dynamic import() which is available in all CommonJS modules. at Object.<anonymous> (/.../node-test/gulpfile.js:3:22) { code: 'ERR_REQUIRE_ESM' }

Description

Changed required statements to imports statements needed to run gulp command without producing errors.

Motivation

To allow users to understand how to add tasks to Gulp without producing errors in the command line interface instead.

Additional details

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: changed require to dynamic imports
